result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Mr Holiday

records.addlTxt: Atty Will Anderson

Parties have reached an agreement in this case and request plea/sentencing dates. DE given notice in hand. Atty will escort DE to the PSB to complete the booking process. 

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Mr Holiday
Current: 710 S Walker Street, Adams, WI 53910 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2022)
Prior: 710 S Walker Street, Friendship, WI 53934 United States

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Christopher Mr Holiday appeared by phone.  Attorney Kara M Rolf in court for Christopher Mr Holiday.  Attorney Cecilia DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court appearance or the conclusion of the case. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

01:34 PM Defendant in court, in custody from the Adams County Jail with Attorney Laura Breun.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Warrant vacated.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
